intro: Lacmellea oblongata, commonly known as the oblong leaf mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. It has a trailing growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as a decorative ground cover. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
